snippet: The speed limit on Broadway, from 59th Street to 220th Street, was lowered on Monday to 25 miles per hour, a change that is part of the city's effort to limit traffic deaths.
abstract: Speed limit on stretch of Broadway in Manhattan that has been the site of 22 traffic-related fatalities since 2008 is lowered to 25 mph from 30 mph limit that applies to rest of New York City; area affected by the speed limit, called an arterial slow zone by the Department of Transportation, is part of Mayor Bill de Blasio’s Vision Zero campaign, an effort across city agencies to limit traffic deaths.
lead_paragraph: The speed limit on Broadway, from 59th Street to 220th Street, was lowered on Monday to 25 miles per hour, a change that is part of the city's effort to limit traffic deaths.

headline.main: Broadway Is Reined In by a Lower Speed Limit
headline.print_headline: Broadway Is Reined In by a Lower Speed Limit
